text: Solidago pinetorum is a North American plant species in the sunflower family, called Small's goldenrod or pineywoods goldenrod.Digital Atlas of the Virginia Flora, Solidago pinetorum Small, Small's Goldenrod, Pineywoods Goldenrod It is found in the east-central United States: Virginia, West Virginia, and the Carolinas.Biota of North America Program 2014 county distribution map Solidago pinetorum is a perennial herb up to 110 cm (44 inches) tall, spreading by means of underground rhizomes. One plant can produce as many as 350 small yellow flower heads in a showy branching array at the top of the plant. The plant grows in open places, often in pine woodlands on hillsides.Flora of North America, Solidago pinetorum Small, 1903. Small’s goldenrod ==References== ==External links== *Lady Bird Johnson Wildflower Center, University of Texas pinetorum Category:Plants described in 1903 Category:Flora of the Eastern United States
title: Solidago pinetorum
